alert.note: Alert for Brown; Butler; Clermont; Clinton; Greene; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF KENTON, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, GRANT, NORTH CENTRAL OWEN, PENDLETON, EAST CENTRAL GALLATIN, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, CLERMONT, EASTERN HAMILTON, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, WARREN, WESTERN CLINTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Monroe to 6 miles west of Dry Ridge, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Florence, Independence, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Erlanger, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland and Franklin. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 68 and 77. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 53. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 151 and 180, and between mile markers 182 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
